settings.heading: Digital Content Manager
settings.content:
January 20, 2022

ABOUT THE ROLE

The Digital Content Manager shares our story with care and intention. From end to end the DCM produces high quality campaigns, content and copy. The DCM works closely with the Head of Marketing to develop content strategy across social, email and web. The ideal candidate is excited to create meaningful connections with our customers and community as the manager of our social media. They have a digital marketing background as well as strong art and design skills. Working independently across multiple projects is central to this role. Martha Stoumen Wines is a small, growing business. We empower each other to evolve systems and bring bold ideas to the table.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

Content Strategy

- Work with Head of Marketing to create and maintain master editorial calendar 

- Develop social advertising campaign strategy with a focus on email subscription growth, club growth and email retention

- Build reach across social and email platforms

- Direct engagement with online community (point of contact for all social media direct communication)

- Manage content library (photos, creative assets, press kits, etc.)

- Bring your boldest ideas to pitch stories and campaigns that uplift our mission and vision

 

Content Production

- Produce marketing campaigns from concept to completion including: art direction, graphic design, copywriting

- Production Assistant for photo and video projects

- Manage project tasks, revision process and tracking of deliverables against deadlines

 

Community Engagement

- Assist in developing collaborator network, liaise with project partners including photographers, printers, etc.

- Support press relations and track press 

- Onsite support for events

 

Internal

- Develop brand-aligned, internal facing materials 

- Attend cross-departmental sales planning and strategy sessions

- Attend weekly & quarterly marketing meetings 

- Keep an eye on current industry trends and forecasts

 

IDEAL QUALIFICATIONS

- Local to the SF Bay Area preferred, but will consider fully remote work for the right candidate

 - Bachelor's degree

- 2+ years of relevant design/marketing experience

- Experience optimizing SEO and executing digital marketing, event marketing and paid advertising campaigns

- Strong graphic design portfolio exhibiting serious skills in Adobe Illustrator, InDesign and Photoshop

- Keen written and verbal communication skills

- Experience managing a branded Instagram account a plus

- Shopify, Klaviyo and Google Analytics experience a plus 

- Photography experience a plus

- Passion for food or beverage industries a plus

- Small business/start up experience a plus

 

HOURS

This is a full-time Monday - Friday salaried role. Typical business hours are the norm but occasional availability on evenings and weekends for events is required. Employment is at will.

COMPENSATION 

Salary is dependent on experience. 

Our excellent benefits include: 

- Healthcare
- Dental
- 401K with a non-elective employer contribution
- Four weeks paid time off per year
- Paid public holidays
- Paid sick leave
- Employee wine allocation 
- Voluntary pre-tax vision coverage
- Voluntary pre-tax health and dependent care flexible spending accounts.

 

ABOUT MARTHA STOUMEN WINES

Martha Stoumen Wines was founded upon the desire to recapture a farming and winemaking culture that has all but faded away: a winemaking culture of patience. We lease vineyards and source grapes from growers who truly put Mother Nature first. We craft low-intervention natural wines at a shared winery in Sebastopol. Our small team has deep winemaking knowledge and creativity is important to us. We produce around 20 wines per year, including our yearly core wines, one-off experiments, and collaborations. 

We share seasonal wine releases through our independent distributors and our Direct to Consumer channel. At the heart of each release is our Community Supported Wine Club, a vibrant community of pleasure-seekers across the country. Our digital presence is the pillar of our hospitality and is supported by caring customer service, occasional events, pop-ups and collaborations. 

Our wines meet any moment, from humble meals in the backyard to elaborate tasting menus. To us, wine culture at its core is about sharing pleasure.

APPLICATION PROCESS

Please send resume, cover letter and portfolio samples to careers@marthastoumen.com with the Subject: Digital Marketing Manager

Martha Stoumen Wines supports workplace diversity and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class. Women, LGBTQ+ folks and people of color are strongly encouraged to apply.

settings.heading: Harvest Internships
settings.content:
We at Martha Stoumen Wines make wine out of a shared space, Pax Mahle Wines, in Sebastopol, CA. Pax, Patrick Cappiello (Monte Rio Cellars), Carlo Mondavi (RAEN), Rosalind Reynolds (Emme Wines) and Martha Stoumen make wine in this facility. We all share a group of interns and work together as a team during harvest, and Rosalind, who is also Pax's Assistant Winemaker, hires and manages all of the interns. All of the harvest interns will work on everyone's wine in the facility, so you'll get great exposure to various winemakers and grape varietals. 

Harvest runs approximately three months from early August to late October/early November, 6 to 7 days a week, and is full of hard physical work, great wine, and team lunches at the long table. It's our favorite time of year.

If interested please send an email and resume to RosalindsReynolds@gmail.com and CC careers@marthastoumen.com. Subject line should read: Harvest 2022 Intern Application
